Token.Abstract: This protocol provides delegate methods to receive the updated video data, camera's current state and lens information.

Video data update callback. H.264 (also called MPEG-4 Part 10 Advanced Video Coding or MPEG-4 AVC) is a video coding format that is currently one of the most commonly used formats for the recording, compression, and distribution of video content.

Parameter.Name: camera
Parameter.Abstract: Camera that sends out the video data.

Parameter.Name: videoBuffer
Parameter.Abstract: H.264 video data buffer. Don't free the buffer after it has been used. The units for the video buffer are bytes.

Parameter.Name: length
Parameter.Abstract: Size of the address of the video data buffer in bytes.

Parameter.Name: camera
Parameter.Abstract: Camera that sends out the video data.

Token.Abstract: Tells the delegate that the lens information is updated. This protocol is available only when isChangeableLensSupported is YES.

Parameter.Name: camera
Parameter.Abstract: Camera that sends out the updatd lens information.
